## Plot a function in `ggplot2`

```{r}
eq = function(x) {
  
  3 * x ^ 2 + 4 
  
  
}

# use stat_function()

ggplot(data = data.frame(x = c(1, 100)), aes(x = x)) + 
  stat_function(fun = eq)


```

### Task 

Plot $f(x)= 2.4-5x^3+2.1x^2$

```{r}
eq = function(x) {
 2.4 - (5 * x) - (5 * (x ^ 3)) + (2.1 * (x ^ 2))  
  
}

ggplot(data = NULL) +
  stat_function(fun = eq) +
  xlim(min = -1, max = 100)

```

over a range from -50 to +50
### `penguins` body mas and flipper lengths

Basic ggplot scatterlot of body mass (y) and flipper length

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g)) +
  geom_point()

```
